str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
Belonging to Tarsus, a Tarsian. From Tarsos; a Tarsean, i.e. Native of Tarsus.
Probably of foreign origin; Cilicia, a region of Asia Minor.
A citizen, fellow-citizen. From polis; a townsman.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
(lit: unmarked, unstamped), undistinguished, obscure, unknown. Unmarked, i.e. ignoble.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To want for myself; I want, need; I beg, request, beseech, pray. Middle voice of deo; to beg, i.e. Petition.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
